file_content.text: Tharan, look over there. Hey, Jedi! Yoo-hoo!
Ah! Here she is, our fair Jedi. Fashionably late, making an entrance.
Ah! Here he is, the gallant Jedi. You took your time.
I thought you two had gone back to your offices.
Hello again.
Is something wrong? Do you need my help?
What's going on?
You're up to something.
After our thrilling sojourn in Shadow Town, I came back to all the contracts piled up on my desk. Humdrum. Tedious. Boring.
And I realized--Nar Shaddaa's charms have staled. I want adventure, excitement, to see something of the galaxy.
So, in exchange for a single billet on your ship, you can have the tech expertise of Doctor Tharan Cedrax exclusively at your disposal. What do you think?
You aren't leaving Holiday behind, are you?
What about Holiday?
Wherever my Tharan goes, I go. I promise I don't take up any space; this software shell is quite slimming.
Now, how could you say no to her, Jedi?
I think that sounds like an excellent idea.
Welcome aboard.
I'm not showering you with credits every time you have an idea.
It'll be an unpaid position.
Genius is its own reward, Jedi.
Besides... good looks, brains and battle prowess--we share a rare combination. Our kind should stick together....
Hmph. Why not just drape yourself over her a little more, Tharan?
Holiday, no other woman has the run-time to understand me like you do. Now, shall we go?
Just one thing: I call first on any exo-tech or lovely females we happen to encounter.
Tharan, you're so naughty. I don't know why I put up with you.
Because you're a paragon of virtue and tolerance, my dear. Now, shall we go?
Congratulations on your handling of Fain--not to mention the Hutt Cartel.
Shocking to see Fain in that state. I see why you couldn't risk letting him live.
Tharan, honey, someone's been calling our offices. Master Syo Bakarn of the Jedi Council, asking for our friend to call back.
Master Syo should know what happened right away.
I'd better report.
Goodbye, Tharan. Thanks for the help.
So we part ways.
The Council's not going anywhere. I'll call him when I'm ready.
He can wait.
I suppose... I should get back to my offices. Genius never takes a vacation.
This was fun--like old times with Syo and Fain. Anyway, glad I could be of assistance. Take care, Jedi.
Fain was a good man, once. What is he now?
Fain's hideout has lost all power. Any security systems will be shut down.
Thank you for having my back, Jedi.
Sending that Imperial grunt away helped me keep my concentration. Thank you.
Don't mention it, Tharan.
You're welcome.
Just doing my job.
Hardly worthy of my talent.
Now, about the guards in the residential area: The prisoners all have explosives planted in their heads, which go off if they leave Shadow Town.
But Holiday can trigger them immediately. A few explosions will distract the guards for us.
You can't just blow up people's heads!
That's terrible!
But even the Empire thinks these people are despicable. This is merciful, compared to what they did to their victims.
It's not for you or me to decide if these people should die.
No. This isn't mercy.
This is wrong. There has to be a better way.
Give me another option.
All right! It's a less elegant solution, but... Holiday, find one of Shadow Town's turrets and overload the magazine.
Found one! Overloading the turret now.
If they're beyond saving, maybe they can die in an honorable cause. Do it.
Very well. Kill them.
If we must, be certain they don't suffer.
Just make it painless.
They're hardly innocents, Jedi, but I understand. Holiday?
It punishes criminals and we get the job done. Do it.
A good solution.
Setting off the explosives now.
This is our chance. We should hurry.
Just a little more time, Jedi!
We can cut the power to Fain's hideout here, but it's complicated. It'll take some time.
What can I do to speed things up?
Need some help?
Regrettably, the position of "lovely assistant" is already taken.
Thank you, but I already have the perfect assistant.
Don't worry about that. I'll protect you.
I'll keep watch.
It won't go faster if you stand around talking.
Then get to work.
Holiday, darling, a little help?
Forgot my--oh. You're that overseer, aren't you? Can I--wait a minute.
What's he doing with the power junction? Hey, you're no Sith!
This man is taking the power junction apart on my orders. It's a disgrace.
I'm overseeing maintenance.
It was serviced yesterday!
No, I'm not an overseer. I'm a Jedi.
Let's end this charade.
Almost forgot to--hey, what's going on?
We're fixing the power junction. It's in a shocking state.
Just maintenance.
Like hell, that was serviced yesterday!
You found whatever you came for. There's nobody else here. Now you're leaving.
[Force Persuade] See nothing.
Yes. Yes, I... heh. Talking to myself, must be slipping.
Do you stir the brains of everyone you meet, Jedi?
If we ever disagree, Jedi, please stick to a convincing argument.
Sorry. You picked the wrong moment to return.
Bad timing. [Attack]
Alert! Alert! We've got an infiltrator!
Wait, Jedi. I need to scramble the Shadow Town camera uplink from here, but if the guard spots any glitches, he'll sound the alarm.
I can get the guard's attention--just tell me for how long.
How much time do you need?
Don't fret, he won't see a thing.
I'll keep him distracted.
He can't sound the alarm if he's dead.
I can silence him.
Drastic, but it would solve my problem.
We only need a minute to muss up the camera uplink. When we're through, he won't notice the difference.
Hey. I didn't know there were Jedi prisoners here. Get back from the guard tower.
I was convicted without due process of law. Where can I argue my case?
I want a lawyer.
What? You're a prisoner of the Empire, you don't get to "argue" anything.
How do you put up with this place?
Do you like it here?
I'm well paid. And well armed, so get back from the guard tower.
You prisoners. Every day, more griping. You're lucky we don't just clean this place out!
Jedi, we're all done!
My apologies, sir. I'll get out of your way.
Sorry to bother you.
Take care.
I have better things to do than argue with some Imperial drone.
I'm leaving, grunt.
Get lost before I lose my temper.
Nothing personal, but... die.
Wait, prisoners don't carry--help!
I've marked our next target on your map. We should hurry.
That was too close. The Hutt Cartel is closing in on Fain.
Your alacrity with a lightsaber may have saved us, but we have other problems.
And for a moment there, you sounded like him; like we don't have enough trouble.
Your quick wit may have allayed suspicion, but we have bigger concerns.
Holiday pinpointed Fain, deep in Shadow Town's residential area. There's dozens of cameras, guards and crazed prisoners between us and him.
You handle the cameras, and I'll handle the prisoners. For the guards, we can set a distraction.
Let's make a plan.
First we get in unseen, then we'll work with what we find. Agreed?
We should be cautious.
You focus on bringing down the defenses, while I take on Shadow Town.
Sounds like a fair fight.
I like your approach. In terms of Fain's mind-control ability, I have a little something to handle that.
"A little something"? You're so modest, Tharan.
I've been consulting with Master Syo Bakarn... and I've built an exo-tech device that should prevent Fain from brainwashing us.
How can a device obstruct a Jedi's influence?
How does it work?
It paralyzes the part of the forebrain that's active when a Jedi tries to impose his will. It'll give Fain a short, sharp shock.
Good thinking. But we should get moving.
Nice work. Let's go.
I need a better guarantee than that, Tharan.
"Should"? You're not sure?
My dear Jedi, do you think I'd risk my genius if I wasn't sure? It will work.
Hmm, Shadow Town--I never planned to see it in person... but I'm ready when you are, Jedi.
We'd better get rid of this fellow as soon as possible.
Of course. Oh my. Fain hasn't covered his tracks very well. I'll just untangle the signal.
I can't let Fain cause any more havoc.
Thank you, but hurry.
Holiday? You're a slicer?
You can do that?
I hope you know what you're doing. This might be my only lead.
Don't mess it up.
When I found Holiday, I discovered this enchanting woman was supported by a computer network of incredible sophistication.
With so much untapped run-time, it seemed a waste not to teach her about slicing.
Found him! Fain's signal traces back to... oh. Shadow Town.
What is Shadow Town?
Shadow Town?
I sense it earned that name.
Sounds unpleasant.
Whatever Shadow Town is, Fain won't be hiding there long.
I'm on my way.
Wait, Jedi! You can't just run in there!
Shadow Town is an Imperial prison for the most dangerous prisoners in the galaxy. Well-nigh impenetrable. The security there is the best on Nar Shaddaa.
The Empire wouldn't waste that much security on merely violent prisoners.
Who's imprisoned there?
Shadow Town houses anyone the Empire needs to watch but can't control. Assassins, insane scientists, experimental specimens....
If Fain's there, I must be able to get inside too.
Fain got in. So can I.
Actually we may have the advantage.
More bad news.
Then here's some overdue good news.
Shadow Town has such exceptional security because the builders had it designed by the best minds. Including myself.
Come back to my offices, and we'll parse the problem. I also have something to help you against Fain.
I thought so. Holiday, my dear, would you oblige?
Jedi! Can you hear me? Are you alright?
Maybe a scratch here and there, but the Force was my shield.
Yes, I'm fine.
I can't believe Fain would do that to another Jedi!
I thought you were monitoring the situation, Tharan.
Why didn't you warn me?
They must have used the Lancers' scrambling gear to conceal themselves.
You thought a few alien thugs could harm me?
I've faced worse.
Actually, I thought they could eviscerate you. I'm so glad to be wrong.
The Morgukai fought well. Herald has earned many points today.
However, Fain may have made a mistake by using that holotransmitter.
Check the holotransmitter, Jedi. Press the small switch underneath, and we'll see what can be done.
Good work, Jedi. The primary control node is active.
Attach that resonator key to the node. In a moment, Klage will think the factories are being destroyed.
To destroy the factories, insert the ID I gave you. It'll corrupt the protocols on that node and set the defenses off.
Stay alert in the lower industrial sector, Jedi.
A few years ago I "acquired" a Sith overseer's ID. I've modified it with the permissions to trigger those defenses, kill everyone and bring the factories down.
I won't kill innocent factory workers. I want an alternative.
I don't want to hurt anyone.
Jedi, those people make spice for the Hutt Cartel. And Klage won't be easy to fool.
I won't sacrifice people if there's any chance to save them.
I said, I'm not hurting them.
I thought you were a genius.
Even with your superior mind?
There's no problem my Tharan can't solve.
I do have a resonator key--a rather rare device. Very well... attach it to the primary control node, and Klage will register its signal as a network failure.
I suppose some sacrifices are necessary to stop Fain.
True. I can't risk my mission.
Good job, Tharan. I appreciate the help.
Thank you.
A mere trifle for a man of my talents... but you're welcome.
I don't want my mission to fail because they changed a password.
You're sure it will work?
I take pride in my work, Jedi. Those permissions will bring the whole system down.
The defense network control room will be near the factories in the lower industrial sector. Once you reach it, I'll help you from there.
I don't envy you. That sector's a toxic nightmare--besides which, there's Imperial soldiers, patrol droids... and worse.
Oh, Tharan. What a deliciously daring idea. I'll have to watch out... in case you get any more.
Dearest Holiday, I always save my finest inspiration for you.
I'll just wait outside until this is all over.
Maybe I should go.
Ahem.
Cool it, you two. We have work to do.
Please, enough.
Ah! Hello again. I believe I promised to help destroy those Hutt Cartel factories for the Lancers. And I've found the perfect solution.
This is Tharan Cedrax. Can you read me, Jedi?
Have the Lancers agreed to meet?
Any news on the meeting?
Yes.
Keep it down a little, please.
Very loudly.
The Lancers leapt at the chance to hire me. Their boss, Klage, is at the meeting ground right now.
I know a local gang, the Red Light Lancers. A bunch of tech "specialists" and slicers of ill repute. Rumor is, they're part of this Guiding Hand.
I need to be in that gang. A Jedi Master wouldn't need slicers unless he was planning something big.
I could discover Fain's plans.
I suspect you're right.
So if I want to join these Red Light Lancers, where should I start?
I'd better find them.
How does the existence of a tech gang help me?
So what?
These Lancers have been pestering me to do a "special job." I could pretend I'm interested and set up a meeting for you.
But you'll need to prove your expertise. I suppose... this prototype would do it. Though I hate to part with it....
Your genius will stop a rogue Jedi Master.
But it'll make you a hero.
Hmph. I wish I was immune to flattery. Here.
I'd owe you a favor....
You'd earn a Jedi's gratitude.
When you put it that way... here you are.
I don't have time to argue. If it'll convince the Lancers, I need that weapon.
Give it to me or I'll take it.
Oh, very well. Just be careful with it.
And here. I always wear an earpiece at handovers so I can call my assistant Holiday. With this, we can speak privately.
Here's the location. I'll return to my office. If Fain is using some kind of mind control, I have research to do.
That was gratifying. You rarely see delinquents getting their just deserts on this world.
And from such an exquisite young woman, too. Loveliness and a lightsaber--a rare synthesis.
Tharan Cedrax? Holiday said to look for you here.
Thanks, but I'm on a mission.
Business before pleasure, I suppose.
Are you always this forward, or was it just the brush with death?
[Flirt] You move fast.
I would be remiss not to acknowledge such beauty.
I just want to know I saved the right person.
Spare me.
And bite, as well. How intriguing.
This is Herald of Scorekeeper, soft one. Show respect.
Impressive title. I'd love to hear more... when your Trandoshan friend is gone.
I'd have talked him around eventually, but I won't say no to heavily armed assistance.
Assistance? Herald saved you. Perhaps to hunt later.
Unless you can mount intelligence on a wall, I'm afraid I wouldn't be a very tempting target.
Did any of those Nikto get near you?
Are you hurt?
Thanks for the concern, but I'm good at dodging.
Though I'd rather not rely on the expertise of strangers.
I'm on an important mission. I believe you're the man I need.
I was looking for you.
Just doing my job.
I just saved your life. A little gratitude wouldn't be out of place.
Not even a "thank you."
My apologies. This has all been very trying.
Tharan Cedrax, professor and exo-engineer, at your service. Not that many around here respect my genius, especially those Nikto.
Challenge the Hutt Cartel? Ha. Where'd they get such delusions of grandeur?
I think you know the man responsible....
From an old friend of yours.
I should start from the beginning....
It's a long story.
If I can get a word in edgewise, I might be able to explain....
Be quiet and I'll tell you.
So Duras Fain has a vendetta against the Hutt Cartel? If any Jedi Master would risk it, Fain's the one.
But Syo's right. If the Hutts find out Fain is behind this Guiding Hand business, it'll leave the Republic high and dry.
Hopefully I can catch him before he does any more damage.
I must find him first.
Master Syo said you could help me find him.
Where would Fain be?
Unfortunately, it's been years since we last spoke.
I intend to stop him long before the Hutt Cartel has a clue.
The Hutts will never know.
No easy task. The Hutts have their claws--well, appendages--into everything around here. Fain will have hidden himself well.
Hmm. Joining the Nikto... you may have been on to something there.
But if Fain is using Nar Shaddaa's gangs, perhaps that's our opening.
Why are people on this world so unreasonable?
It's been some time since I worked alongside a Jedi.
Good, the earpiece is working. Naturally. I did design it, after all.
